abstracts.cdata!:
Although overall, Iran has achieved a
            remarkable improvement of health outcomes of the population
            since it first established its innovative primary health
            care network in the late 1980s and during the ten-year
            period of project implementation, the project did not
            achieve its specific objectives and the project outcome is
            therefore given an unsatisfactory rating. however, this ICR
            rates overall project sustainability as likely. World Bank
            performance is considered unsatisfactory, although Bank
            management and staff were very responsive in giving good
            quality sector advise and in providing assistance to resolve
            project implementation issues in a timely manner. Borrower
            performance overall was also unsatisfactory despite
            Government cooperation because unfamiliarity with Bank
            policies, guidelines and procedures, and conflicts between
            these conditions and Iranian laws and administrative
            procedures, obstructed senior Government officials to take
            timely actions to expedite project implementation. Lessons
            learned were described broadly as recognizing the need for
            rigorous sector analysis where Bank knowledge of a sector is
            minimal as well as rigorous institutional and capacity
            analysis at all levels of implementation; and being willing
            to invest adequate resources. Some specific lessons focused
            on involving all key partners in project preparation; and
            developing a sound project implementation plan owned by the
            Borrower for each component while building capacity of
            counterpart staff.
